item.title: Parallel Processing with Bash
item.description: Last week at work I had to whip up a script to process several thousand ids for product analysis on a new feature we’re launching. The processing included making HTTP requests to a service, and I was on a deadline, so the script had to be concurrent. Here’s what I came up with: #!/bin/bash startline=2 setsize=1200 for i in {1..5};do tail -n+$startline ids.tsv \ | cut -f4 \ | head -n $setsize \ | .
